title: left
description: The `left` CSS property specifies the horizontal offset of a positioned element from the left edge of its containing block.
content: The property that sets the distance between the left edge of an element and the left edge of its containing block. It's used with the `position` property set to 'absolute' or 'fixed' to control horizontal placement relative to the nearest ancestor or viewport, while with 'relative' it shifts the element from its original position.
